remarks: was going for some kind of king's gambit; sacrificed knight to force enemy king out of position; opponent resigned after hanging a queen -- lucky win

remarks: one of my strongest and most accurate games yet in general; opponent spent a lot of time making questionable queen moves, and as a result I won
moveList: "1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 e6 3. d4 d5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Qe2+ Be7 6. Bg5 dxc4 7. Qe5 f6 8.Bxf6 Nxf6 9. Qg5 g6 10. Qh6 Qxd4 11. Qg7 Rg8 12. c3 Qe4+ 0-1"

remarks: I got lucky when he failed to take two hanging pieces, and then I took advantage of a few questionable moves to win the game -- could have gone either way! An early queen trade (forcing his king to take and no longer be able to castle) set the stage for a positional game. He resigned after I took a hanging bishop, but had he taken either of the pieces I had left hanging I would have lost.

remarks: a couple of hung pawns and a questionable bishop sacrifice almost cost me the game; managed to make a draw out of it with careful play; this was a case of getting lucky in the midgame, as if my opponent had not made two blunders I wouldn't have been able to secure a draw by agreement.

remarks: a tough game where my opponent played very well. one worth studying. Blundered into a checkmate at the end, but they probably would have won even if I hadn't. Pretty good game! This is probably one where knowing more about the opening would have allowed me to fare better.

remarks: a tough game. I'm still not sure why I do so well with the italian game when playing black, but I'll take it! A crucial rook sacrifice gave me the chance to checkmate, and since the opponent was playing well it took a little while to get. Good win! This game featured a rare kingside castle in the midgame after the f-pawn had been removed from the file, so it had a king's gambit flavor to it sort of.

remarks: opponent played the scandiavian defense and it cost them the game. They resigned after a series of forced queen moves left a knight fork of the king and rook open. The chess.com analysis says I made a blunder here by not going for a queen trade, but I didn't consider it one and I won the game. At a higher level the trade would have probably been a stronger move.

remarks: an early attack on the center worked out. took advantage of pins and tempo-gaining attacks on the queen to win. opponent resigned after I pinned their queen.
moveList: "1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. c3 Bc5 4. d4 exd4 5. cxd4 Bb4+ 6. Nc3 Bxc3+ 7. bxc3 d5 8.e5 Bg4 9. Be2 f6 10. O-O Qe7 11. Qa4 Bxf3 12. Bxf3 O-O-O 13. Ba3 Qe6 14. Qd1fxe5 15. Bg4 1-0"

remarks: baited opponent into hanging their queen early, and then later baited them into a queen fork of both rooks, after which they blundered into a checkmate -- got lucky!
moveList: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Qf6 3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 Bc5 5. Nf5 Nh6 6. Qf3 d5 7. Nxh6 Qxh6 8.Bxh6 gxh6 9. exd5 c6 10. dxc6 Nxc6 11. Bb5 Bd7 12. Qe2+ Kf8 13. O-O Re8 14. Qh5Re5 15. Qxh6+ Ke8 16. Bxc6 bxc6 17. Qf6 Re7 18. Qxh8# 1-0

remarks: a good game -- almost had a chance for an early checkmate, but opponent made the correct move to block it. Instead, a timely queen trade and knight sacrifice opened up the position of their castled king, allowing me to apply pressure for the rest of the game, resulting in an eventual win in the endgame when the opponent resigned after losing all their pieces. At a key point in the endgame, the opponent missed a mate-in-3, and moved their rook to an unwise position, allowing me to win the endgame with careful play. Of note is that the analysis engine suggests my queen trade to ruin the king's castle was not a winning move, so it can be assumed that with better play my opponent might have won from there. In the future, it would be a good idea to make sure the queen can't interfere with that attack before it commences.

remarks: an interesting game. an early queen attack by the opponent was foiled, giving me a midgame advantage which I squandered with a questionable rook sacrifice in a premature attempt to checkmate. although the opponent had me after that, they blundered into the very checkmate a couple turns later. lucky win against a tough opponent.
